snippet.textDisplay:
Responce Experimental mode
Great idea aggressive Changes keeps the game fresh and allows you to experiment better
You see this also in dota which is in my oppinion a better ballanced game then for say league
Dota has aggressive Changes while league minor once

Second one
Hero Pools
I honestly do not think this is a great idea for the mayor reason that you have to little hero choice for you to be removing heroes at random.
Since players have often got their prefered hero having this can randomly cripple a team because you took out 4 of their best heroes.
I think the experimental mode will probably end up having more impact on the meta while the hero pool change isnt nessesary
I think a better option would be is a small banlist.
Each team can ban 2 heroes they dont want to see in play. which will be banned for Both sides!
You can only pick 1 hero from a trade. thus if you pick a tank you cant remove another tank.
This means at max only 2 heroes from each trade can be banned.

I think that will spice things up and makes it also easy to pin point heroes that are deemed over powered cause they get a very common ban
While this is also a 4 hero removal.
This way you can create an advantage by removing 2 heroes your opponants are great with and vice versa
And not having randomly get a massive impact nerf on 1 team while the other has no problems at all.
snippet.textOriginal:
Responce Experimental mode
Great idea aggressive Changes keeps the game fresh and allows you to experiment better
You see this also in dota which is in my oppinion a better ballanced game then for say league
Dota has aggressive Changes while league minor once

Second one
Hero Pools
I honestly do not think this is a great idea for the mayor reason that you have to little hero choice for you to be removing heroes at random.
Since players have often got their prefered hero having this can randomly cripple a team because you took out 4 of their best heroes. 
I think the experimental mode will probably end up having more impact on the meta while the hero pool change isnt nessesary
I think a better option would be is a small banlist. 
Each team can ban 2 heroes they dont want to see in play. which will be banned for Both sides!
You can only pick 1 hero from a trade. thus if you pick a tank you cant remove another tank.
This means at max only 2 heroes from each trade can be banned.

I think that will spice things up and makes it also easy to pin point heroes that are deemed over powered cause they get a very common ban
While this is also a 4 hero removal. 
This way you can create an advantage by removing 2 heroes your opponants are great with and vice versa
And not having randomly get a massive impact nerf on 1 team while the other has no problems at all.

snippet.textDisplay:
Hero pool sounds like an awful idea. A large portion of the player base loves and mains specific characters. Limiting or removing those characters “just because” sounds terrible. Map pools are different, because you can still play your character of choice on said map. I’d personally much prefer bans over this hero pool nonsense, at least then the reason is “enemy chose to ban my character of choice” rather than “RNG gavel says I don’t get to play my favorite hero for a week.”

Im not here for this hero pools nonsense. Balance the game, don’t just randomly remove heroes for no reason.
snippet.textOriginal:
Hero pool sounds like an awful idea. A large portion of the player base loves and mains specific characters. Limiting or removing those characters “just because” sounds terrible. Map pools are different, because you can still play your character of choice on said map. I’d personally much prefer bans over this hero pool nonsense, at least then the reason is “enemy chose to ban my character of choice” rather than “RNG gavel says I don’t get to play my favorite hero for a week.”

Im not here for this hero pools nonsense. Balance the game, don’t just randomly remove heroes for no reason.

snippet.textDisplay: Dude you just have to change your advisers cause they don't give you good advice. All these changes and desicions are making the game worse. It all started with the stupid 222 idea. It ruined the game for everyone, DPS players the most. You gonna expect a 15 minute queue at the very least when you wanna play DPS and the queue time is usually longer than the game. It's so boring to wait 15 minutes in the queue and then get an unfair game. This hero pool desicion is the last nail on the coffin. You just don't seem to know how to fix the meta and make balance changes, instead of doing that you introduce hero pools. What about one tricks ? Have you thought about a torb main(like me) who doesn't have good aim to play mccree or ashe ? When torb is not in the hero pool , what can he do ? He doesn't have good aim to play hitscan, doesn't know how to play genji or doom cause they are complicated. He has to play a hero he is not good at, so he loses the game and that is not fun. Imagine being in a queue for 15 minutes then play a hero whom you don't know to play with and then losing ! That's not fun. I'm telling you, you gonna lose more players and many will quit. I've already quit. I used to play only OW for 2 years but after 222 I barely play. Now I guess I will never play again and it's a shame. OW used to be a good and fun game. I think Blizzard needs a Donlad Trump to #makeOverwatchGreatAgain
snippet.textOriginal: Dude you just have to change your advisers cause they don't give you good advice. All these changes and desicions are making the game worse. It all started with the stupid 222 idea. It ruined the game for everyone, DPS players the most. You gonna expect a 15 minute queue at the very least when you wanna play DPS and the queue time is usually longer than the game. It's so boring to wait 15 minutes in the queue and then get an unfair game. This hero pool desicion is the last nail on the coffin. You just don't seem to know how to fix the meta and make balance changes, instead of doing that you introduce hero pools. What about one tricks ? Have you thought about a torb main(like me) who doesn't have good aim to play mccree or ashe ? When torb is not in the hero pool , what can he do ? He doesn't have good aim to play hitscan, doesn't know how to play genji or doom cause they are complicated. He has to play a hero he is not good at, so he loses the game and that is not fun. Imagine being in a queue for 15 minutes then play a hero whom you don't know to play with and then losing ! That's not fun. I'm telling you, you gonna lose more players and many will quit. I've already quit. I used to play only OW for 2 years but after 222 I barely play. Now I guess I will never play again and it's a shame. OW used to be a good and fun game. I think Blizzard needs a Donlad Trump to #makeOverwatchGreatAgain

snippet.textDisplay: I have noticed a lot of players would like to have the ability to random skin select, as well as victory poses. Some players would like to be able to select a few skins to be chosen, and randomly selected when getting into game. (Same for victory poses, and highlights) For example: Mercy's pink skin, witch skin, and imp skin, are chosen, when you get into a game it randomly selects one of those skins for you. I would also like this setting, because sometimes I want a skin surprise.
snippet.textOriginal: I have noticed a lot of players would like to have the ability to random skin select, as well as victory poses. snippet.textDisplay: I feel like Doom should get a nurf on his punch, me personally I don’t mind it too much but my friends and teammates hate him. And I feel like the problem with doom is the distance he goes with the punch and then hits someone should affect how much damage it will do to a player. For example if you hold the punch for max damage and go forward and just barely before it’s about to end, the player getting hits gets the full force of the punch as if it were point blank. I feel that depending on distance you go with punch and when you hit them should change how much damage it does.
snippet.textOriginal: I feel like Doom should get a nurf on his punch, me personally I don’t mind it too much but my friends and teammates hate him. And I feel like the problem with doom is the distance he goes with the punch and then hits someone should affect how much damage it will do to a player. For example if you hold the punch for max damage and go forward and just barely before it’s about to end, the player getting hits gets the full force of the punch as if it were point blank. I feel that depending on distance you go with punch and when you hit them should change how much damage it does.

Please buff symetra's secondary fire 😢
Her primary fire is barely usable because she can't get in close without immediately dying. If her secondary had slightly faster projectile speed, she would have different ways to play. I know the devs don't like sym but please make her useable without making her cancer!

snippet.textDisplay: Jeff, I'd just like to thank you and your team for listening to the community in what seems like the new format of game developers not caring about the community and only caring about shareholders and money. snippet.textDisplay: 아니 222고정도 결국엔 유저말대로 222선픽제로했으면 됬는데 고정으로 해서 망했는데 유저들이 벤픽넣어라해도 로테이션으로 넣는다?그냥 둠피 머리카락만큼 생각없는거냐 아님 그냥 병인거냐 이건 ㄹㅇ 욕하게해줘라 4년전엔 핵 3년전에는 괜찮았자 근데 지금봐바 밸런스도 안맞고 서칭도 긴데 가냥 222선픽제로해두면 될걸 아님 탱커를 재미있게하든지 메타 고착화 현상을 만들지 않게 1시즌 끝날때라도 메타가 바뀌게 그 메타에 사용된 영웅을 그냥 고인으로 만들고 안사용된 영웅을 버프하면 접은 유저 50%이상은 돌아온다 ㄹㅇ

snippet.textDisplay:
For me personally, the problem with Overwatch was, from the beginning, the differentiating between offensive and defensive DPS heroes, that generated the huge gap between the number of DPS and the two other types of heroes. As long as this persists, OW will only be a "second class" game to me, that balancing can only patch things up, but not fix them.



If OW2 fixes it and adds AMAZING PvE AI, OW2 will be one of the top games in the first half of the decade, I guarantee it.
snippet.textOriginal:
For me personally, the problem with Overwatch was, from the beginning, the differentiating between offensive and defensive DPS heroes, that generated the huge gap between the number of DPS and the two other types of heroes. As long as this persists, OW will only be a "second class" game to me, that balancing can only patch things up, but not fix them. 



If OW2 fixes it and adds AMAZING PvE AI, OW2 will be one of the top games in the first half of the decade, I guarantee it.

snippet.textDisplay:
Food for thought
Instead of hero pools, give both teams 2 bans every game.
Make the highest endorsed player on the team captain and deciding on bans.
And make it so that no more than 1 role can be banned from each team per game.
snippet.textOriginal:
Food for thought
Instead of hero pools, give both teams 2 bans every game.
Make the highest endorsed player on the team captain and deciding on bans.
And make it so that no more than 1 role can be banned from each team per game.
